ygData.subject: RE: [archive-crawler] How do i retrieve a page's last modified date?
ygData.msgSnippet: You ll need to have a recent version (current HEAD preferably) as this was recently added. You can access the HttpMethod object via the CrawlURIs AList ... The

Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

You'll need to have a recent version (current HEAD preferably) as this was
=
recently added. 
 
You can access the HttpMethod object via the CrawlURIs A=
List
 
> HttpMethod method =3D curi.getObject(A_HTTP_TRANSACTION) 
 
The co=
nstant A_HTTP_TRANSACTION is defined in the interface
CoreAttributeConstant=
s. 
Once you have the method it just a matter of getting the relevant field=

value.
 
> String s =3D method.getResponseHeader("last-modified").getValue=
();
 
-Kris
 

-----Original Message-----
From: pm5400845 [mailto:philippe.=

Sent: 10. febr=FAar 2005 12:22
To: archive-crawler@yah=
oogroups.com
Subject: [archive-crawler] How do i retrieve a page's last mod=
ified date?



Hi all,

I am writing a multidimensional search engine: www.=
net2map.org. 
I am currently rewriting the crawler part, using a very simpl=
e 
Processor which extracts all the useful information from the
CrawlURIs i=
t receive, and feeds them to the Lucene indexer.
In the CrawlURI, i have fo=
und many informations about the URL
being crawled, but not the date and the=
 HTTP headers.

How do I retrieves these pieces of information?

Thank you =
in advance for your answer!
